alert.note: Alert for Newaygo (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:50PM EDT until April 11 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ada affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County. Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County. Grand River at Grand Rapids affecting Kent County. Kalamazoo River at New Richmond affecting Allegan County. Muskegon River at Bridgeton affecting Newaygo County. Muskegon River at Newaygo affecting Newaygo County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Thornapple River Near Caledonia affecting Kent County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County. .Water from heavy rains earlier in the week continue to work through the rivers in West Michigan. Dry weather is forecast for much of the next week which will help in allowing the rivers to fall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskegon River at Bridgeton. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flood water begins surrounding cottages and homes downstream from the City of Newaygo in the areas of Leisure Land Subdivision in Bridgeton Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Friday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 12/31/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
